q: Understanding population is presented by __________.
__________ size refers to the number of individuals in a population.
__________ density is the number of individuals per unit area or volume.
Population density can be calculated by dividing population size by total __________ area.
Population __________ refers to the relative representation of a species in a particular ecosystem.
Population density may change as a result of __________ or human induced factors.
Higher orangutan densities are found in __________ habitats that experience less extreme periods of fruit shortage.
In logged areas, __________ orangutan densities are found in moderately to heavily logged forest than in unlogged or lightly logged areas.
__________ rate (natality) is the number of individuals added annually to the present population through reproduction per 1000 individual.
__________ rate (mortality) is the number of individuals that die annually per 1000 individual.
Growth rate is usually expressed in __________.
Growth rate = (number of births â€“ number of deaths) / __________ x 100
Doubling time = __________ / Growth rate (%)
The number 70 in the doubling time formula is called the __________ constant.
A population may have up to __________ different age groups in it.
__________ are immature organisms not yet reproductively active.
__________ are organisms that produce offspring.
__________ are organisms that have ceased to breed because of disease or old age.
__________ dispersion is a pattern of spacing found in forests & coral reefs.
__________ dispersion is a pattern of spacing found in plantations & territorial animals.
__________ dispersion is a pattern of spacing found in schooling fish, herding animals & flocking birds.
__________ refers to the movement of members into a population.
__________ refers to the movement of members out of a population.
__________ ratio refers to the number of males compared to the number of females in a population.
The population __________ when carrying capacity is reached.
__________ are organisms that have long life spans and give birth only to a few offspring.
__________ are organisms that usually produce large number of eggs or offspring.
K-strategists provide __________ parental care compared to R-strategists.
R-strategists provide __________ parental care compared to K-strategists.
